newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - European precious metals seen lower.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - European precious metals seen lower.

text.p: SPOT NY CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Gold is expected to move towards the lower end of its $340.00/$345.00 an ounce trade range on Friday, traders and chartists said.
Devoid of market-moving news, gold was likely to be influenced by the dollar, which was steady in early European trading.
Silver was expected to drift lower while platinum might test $385.00 support.
GOLD - Seen pressured lower but unlikely to break below support at $340.00 on Friday.

"The market is trending lower and is not been helped by the dollar," one trader said, adding gold would hold above $340.00. "Even if that gives way there is further support at $339.00/$339.50," he said.

Referring to the Comex June gold contract, Martin Squires of Rudolf Wolff said, "With the firming dollar and the continued downward bias of the technical indicators we favour a return to test key support at $339.50."
On the charts a downtrend line joining the highs of May 14, 15, 16 and 22 should offer resistance.
Resistance is also likely to be found from the downtrending 30-day moving average at around $342.83.
At 0730 GMT spot gold was quoted at $341.50/341.90, against Thursday's London close of $342.50/$343.00.
SILVER - Might move to test support at $4.60 against a backdrop of downtrending charts and gold's gentle drift lower.
On the charts the 10-day moving average was moving towards a downside cross on its 30-day counterpart.
A break below $4.60 could see a slump to the March 1995 lows of $4.56 and 4.38. "At the moment levels around $4.60 are important," one trader said.
At 0745 spot silver was indicated at $4.66/$4.68, down two cents.
PLATINUM - Lower, but should hold support at $385.00.
This weeks news that Russia would resume PGMs exports should keep the market on a defensive footing.
At 0750 GMT platinum was indicated at $387.25/$388.25, against $387.75/$388.75.
-- London Newsroom +44 171 542-8075
